intro: Stoebe mossii, commonly known as purple highbush cranberry, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and have a leathery texture, while its berries are edible and often used in traditional herbal remedies. Stoebe mossii thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky areas.
